alert.note: Alert for Chicot (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 04 at 4:06PM CDT until July 04 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Chicot County in southeastern Arkansas... Southwestern Bolivar County in northwestern Mississippi... Northwestern Washington County in northwestern Mississippi... * Until 615 PM CDT. * At 406 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Greenville, Metcalfe, Benoit, Winterville, Scott and Lamont. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
